intro: Loxopterygium kuasango, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive tubular shape. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments.
